page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: The{oldest}houses (1880-1900) are along West End Road and Clipsley Lane, then Blackbrook Road (c 1900). Between the wars new houses appeared at Woodlands Road, Carr Mill (on Litherland Farm), and round Grosvenor Road. About 1950 a new{Council estate} (at Glade Hill Farm), and the estate west of Carr Mill Dam were built. Since 1960 there has been much in-filling, and the creation of large estates at Legh Road, Chain Lane, west of Haydock Lane and at Grange Valley. All the houses are{brick-built,}though the older ones have{slate roofs.}Only the Glade Hill Farm estate is wholly cement-rendered. The oldest houses are still being{modernised}(e.g. new gable ends, windows,etc), and in the Legh Road estate more than 60% have been altered or extended (new porches, windows, garages or extensions).
